ARABIC: بَلِ ٱللَّهَ فَٱعْبُدْ وَكُن مِّنَ ٱلشَّٰكِرِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No! Worship Allah and be among the thankful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So, you should worship only God, arid be among the grateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Therefore, serve Allah alone and be among those who give thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (Muhammad), You must worship God alone and give Him thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: But rather worship only Allah, and be among the thankful!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Nay! But worship Allah, and be among the grateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nay! but serve Allah alone and be of the thankful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Nay, but God do thou serve; and be thou among the thankful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nay, but Allah must thou serve, and be among the thankful!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Therefore, you should worship God alone and be among the thankful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Aye! Allah must thou worship, and be among the thankful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: No, worship Allah, and be among the grateful!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nay, but worship Allah, and be of those who give thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nay! But worship Allah (Alone and none else), and be among the grateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: No, worship Allah and be with those who give thanks!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Rather, worship God, and be of the appreciative.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Rather, worship [only] Allah and be among the grateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [39:66] Rather, worship God, alone, and be among the thankful, of His bestowal of graces on you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nay, but Allah must thou serve) you must believe in Allah's divine Oneness, (and be among the thankful) for what Allah has bestowed upon you of prophethood, Scripture and Islam!
